cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

The paper proposes a framework for improving the accuracy of first-stage retrieval algorithms by learning context-aware term weights for sentences and passages using BERT's contextualized text representations. This suggests that the paper belongs to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses deep learning techniques such as BERT, which suggests that it could also belong to the Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also mentions experiments and evaluation, which suggests that it could belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a novel approach that improves the accuracy of first-stage retrieval algorithms, which suggests that it could also belong to the Deep Learning (cs.DL) sub-category.
